title: Support for Views-backed ActiveRecord models
body:
Suppose we have an ActiveRecord model created by a database view. A guide on this technique can be found here (http://enterpriserails.chak.org/full-text/chapter-11-view-backed-models)

The long and short of it is that outside of create/update/delete, a database view can be queried just like any other ActiveRecord models. For instance we can do
`ViewModel.where(:student_id => '1234').count` and it would work just as if this Model is an actual table in the database.

If we were to use View backed AR model with ActiveAdmin however, it doesn't seem to work very nicely. Here is the stack-trace if we were to use a views-based ActiveRecord Model in an application.

